module_restrictions: Exchange students may not enrol in courses offered at the BU Medical School, School of Dental Medicine, Law School, Graduate School of Management, and Kilachand Honors College.
visa_info: All students are advised to apply for the necessary visa immediately after they receive the official offer letter/email from their host university.
accommodations_info: Upon acceptance exchange students will receive a brochure outlining Boston University on-campus housing options and costs.
cost_of_living: Information on the cost of living and attendance at Boston University can be found via: http://www.bu.edu/abroad/plan/financial-aid/ (Budgeting Tab). Exchange students can deduct the cost of tuition which they will not need to pay to BU.
university_description: Boston University is a private research university in Boston, Massachusetts. The university offers undergraduate and graduate programs across 17 schools and colleges.
university_address: One Silber Way, Boston, MA 02215, USA
location_cost_of_living: Boston has a high cost of living, with rent, transportation, and food being particularly expensive.
location_weather: Boston has a humid continental climate with warm summers and cold winters, with occasional rainfall throughout the year.
location_description: Boston is known for its rich history, cultural landmarks, and world-renowned universities. It is a major commercial, financial, and cultural center in the United States.
location_crime: Boston has a low crime rate compared to other major cities in the United States, but incidents of theft and petty crime can occur.
location_transportation: Boston has an extensive public transportation system, including a subway system, buses, and commuter rails.
location_halal: There are several halal food options available in Boston, particularly in the neighborhoods of Allston and Brighton.
location_vegetarian: Boston has many vegetarian and vegan restaurants, particularly in the neighborhoods of Cambridge and Somerville.
